targets.Name: ceilingLight
targets.Text: This is a ceiling lamp. It is not an asthma trigger.

targets.Name: Window1
targets.Text: This is a window. It is not an asthma trigger.

targets.Name: Window2
targets.Text: This is also a window. It is not an asthma trigger.

targets.Name: Cat_1
targets.Text: Furry pets can trigger an asthma attack. Keep furry pets out of bedrooms. Wash furry pets often

targets.Name: Bed
targets.Text: This is a bed. ASTHMA TRIGGER

targets.Name: Plant
targets.Text: This is a plant. It's fake. Not an asthma trigger.

targets.Name: Dresser
targets.Text: This is a dresser. It's a piece of furniture. Your lungs are safe.

targets.Name: Nightstand
targets.Text: This is a nightstand. It is also a piece of furniture. Your lungs are still safe.

targets.Name: Dust_1
targets.Text: This is some dust. Beware, the ultimate asthma trigger.

targets.Name: Frog
targets.Text: Dust mites live in items made of thick fibers, such as stuffed toys. Stuffed toys are a source for dust mites. Reduce or remove stuffed toys from the child's bedroom.

targets.Name: Bunny
targets.Text: Dust mites live in items made of thick fibers, such as stuffed toys. Stuffed toys are a source for dust mites. Reduce or remove stuffed toys from the child's bedroom.

targets.Name: Bear
targets.Text: Dust mites live in items made of thick fibers, such as stuffed toys. Stuffed toys are a source for dust mites. Reduce or remove stuffed toys from the child's bedroom.

targets.Name: Perfume_1
targets.Text: Spray and strong scents can trigger asthma. Avoid use of sprays in home. Avoid use of products that are heavily scented in home.
